dmca.title: [TP-C474165Q] Copyright Violation
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal. Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Tuesday, August 15, 2006 4:39 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C474165Q] Copyright Violation. Subject: [TP-C474165Q] Copyright Violation. From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C474165Q] Copyright Violation. Reference: [TP-C474165Q] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Copyright Violation. Added by system at Tuesday, Aug 15 2006 09:37 am X-MailFrom: contact_editor@developershed.com X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.180] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Tue Aug 15 09:36:36 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Tue, 15 Aug 2006 09:36:35 -0500 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.111]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from contact_editor@developershed.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GD01z-0004uv-3Q for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Tue, 15 Aug 2006 09:36:35 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Tue, 15 Aug 2006 09:36:34 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from contact_editor@developershed.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GD01y-000227-Jh for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 15 Aug 2006 09:36:34 -0500 Received: from mail.devshed.com ([84.40.21.254]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from contact_editor@developershed.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GD01u-0006BL-8G for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 15 Aug 2006 09:36:30 -0500 Received: (qmail 94427 invoked by uid 89); 15 Aug 2006 14:36:27 -0000 Received: from unknown (HELO RICKCOMP) (72.158.241.35) by 0 with SMTP; 15 Aug 2006 14:36:27 -0000 From: "Charles Fagundes" To: Subject: Copyright Violation. Date: Tue, 15 Aug 2006 10:36:26 -0400 Message-ID: <013b01c6c078$309ecd80$0901a8c0@RICKCOMP> MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_NextPart_000_013C_01C6C056.A98D2D80" X-Priority: 3 (Normal) X-MSMail-Priority: Normal X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook, Build 10.0.6626 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2962 Importance: Normal Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 84.40.21.254 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of developershed.com) client-ip=84.40.21.254; envelope-from=contact_editor@developershed.com; helo=mail.devshed.com; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 15 Aug 2006 14:36:34.0708 (UTC) FILETIME=[35284D40:01C6C078] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) To Whom It May Concern: My name is Charles Fagundes and I am the managing editor at Developer Shed.com. It has come to our attention that a site that is under your IP allocation, HYPERLINK "http://www.mycplus.com/"www.mycplus.com, is violating our copyrights by using our articles without permission. The tutorials HYPERLINK "http://www.mycplus.com/tutorial.asp?TID=298"http://www.mycplus.com/tuto rial asp?TID=298 and HYPERLINK "http://www.mycplus.com/cplus.asp?CID=78"http://www.mycplus.com/cplus.as p?CI D=78, are both from our site (www.devarticles.com). The link found in the latter article still goes to our site. Can you please help us remedy this situation? We appreciate any help you can give us to get this issue corrected. Thanks, HYPERLINK "mailto:charles@developershed.com"Charles Fagundes, Editor (954) 435-6801 Ext: 03 HYPERLINK "http://www.developershed.com/"Developer Shed, Inc. -- No virus found in this outgoing message. Checked by AVG Free Edition. Version: 7.1.405 / Virus Database: 268.10.10/419 - Release Date: 8/15/2006 MIME element (text/html)

To Whom It May Concern:

 

My name is Charles Fagundes and I am the managing editor at Developer Shed.com. It has come to our attention that a site that is under your IP allocation, www.mycplus.com, is violating our copyrights by using our articles without permission. The tutorials http://www.mycplus.co m/tutorial.asp?TID=298 and http://www.mycplus.com/cp lus.asp?CID=78, are both from our site (www.devarticles.com). The link found in the latter article still goes to our site.

 

Can you please help us remedy this situation? We appreciate any help you can give us to get this issue corrected.

 

Thanks,

Charles Fagundes, Editor
(954) 435-6801 Ext: 03
Developer Shed, Inc.

 


--
No virus found in this outgoing message.
Checked by AVG Free Edition.
Version: 7.1.405 / Virus Database: 268.10.10/419 - Release Date: 8/15/2006
